item.title: Predicting Grades
item.description: Just saw this: <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Evaluation metric idea: take snapshots of students&#39; grades each week (specifically, the grade they actually see in your LMS). How well do these correlate with your final assigned grade? Were students getting good estimates?</p>&mdash; Austin Cory Bart (@AustinCorgiBart) <a href="https://twitter.com/AustinCorgiBart/status/1129743671639838720?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">May 18, 2019</a></blockquote> <script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> It made me think of a couple of conversations I had with more senior teachers early in my career.

item.title: Unit Tests Grading Workflow
item.description: I've talked before about unit testing (here, and here). My premise is that in addition to being an important industry technique, it's a sound practice for students studying CS. I also contend that it can make grading easier on the teacher. Maybe not as easy as an auto-grader but those have their own problems. Since I spent most of today grading I thought I'd share my current workflow and how unit tests have made me more efficient.
